definition: to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: I am a divorced and have a teenaged daughter.
sentences.chinese: 我離異，有一個十幾歲的女兒。

sentences.english: He had one child, who is, of course, with his ex-wife.
sentences.chinese: 他剛離異，一個孩子自然跟了前妻。

sentences.english: Then one day, a divorced 41-year-old American showed up saying he wanted to adopt her.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，一個41歲的美國離異男人表示要收養她。

sentences.english: Another recently divorced friend drove this point home.
sentences.chinese: 我另一位離異的朋友能作爲佐證。

sentences.english: As the recession rumbles on, the number of Americans claiming welfare (cash assistance aimed mostly at poor mothers of dependent children) appears at last to be rising.
sentences.chinese: 這一救濟中的現金援助主要針對貧困的離異母親。

sentences.english: Divorced individuals are increasingly choosing cohabitation as an alternative to marriage.
sentences.chinese: 離異人士逐漸選擇同居來作爲婚姻的替代品。

sentences.english: During their divorce, the actress argued for rights to keep Flossie .
sentences.chinese: 當這對夫妻離異時，這位女星贏得弗洛西領養權。

sentences.english: He was 44, divorced, his backyard overrun with crabgrass.
sentences.chinese: 他44歲，離異，後院長滿了雜草。

sentences.english: Last year, Sichuan ranked seventh nationwide in terms of the number of divorcees.
sentences.chinese: 去年，四川離異人數位列全國第七。

sentences.english: Other divorced individuals may have a series of cohabiting relationships without ever remarrying.
sentences.chinese: 其他離異的人可能沒有再婚，但有一系列的同居關係。

sentences.english: At the age of nine, Tasha's parents divorced, and she moved to Greenwich Village with her mother.
sentences.chinese: 塔莎九歲時父母離異，她跟着母親搬到了格林威治村。

sentences.english: Yang Feihong is divorced, no children, this is very satisfied with her mother.
sentences.chinese: 楊飛鴻也是離異，沒有孩子，這點孫媽媽很滿意。

sentences.english: The time of separation, who breaded and so on hadn't significant influence to the subject personality.
sentences.chinese: 離異時間等因素對研究對象人格無顯著影響。

sentences.english: One of the major fear of school -aged children is that their parents will divorce.
sentences.chinese: 在校學生一個主要的恐懼來源於他們父母的離異。

sentences.english: She is divorced with two grown-up sons and lives with her partner.
sentences.chinese: 曾經離異，現和自己的兩個兒子和新伴侶生活。

sentences.english: According to a newspaper, children from divorced parents are generally more crime-prone.
sentences.chinese: 據報載，離異家庭的孩子一般來說更容易犯罪。

definition: to get married and have kids/to start a family
